segment.source: Prepare a Network Policy Server (NPS) for Imaging

segment.source: If you intend to create an image of an installation for deployment to a different computer, and the Network Policy Server (NPS) service is installed on the source server, you may have to first remove confidential information that's stored on the server.
segment.target: If you intend to create an image of an installation for deployment to a different computer, and the Network Policy Server (NPS) service is installed on the source server, you may have to first remove confidential information that's stored on the server.

segment.source: Use these procedures to remove the relevant settings and data from the NPS configuration.
segment.target: Use these procedures to remove the relevant settings and data from the NPS configuration.

segment.source: To delete RADIUS clients from the NPS configuration
segment.target: To delete RADIUS clients from the NPS configuration

segment.source: Display the list of Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) clients on the NPS server.
segment.target: Display the list of Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) clients on the NPS server.

segment.source: To do that, open an elevated command prompt, type this command, and then press Enter:
segment.target: To do that, open an elevated command prompt, type this command, and then press Enter:

segment.source: Delete each RADIUS client in the list.
segment.target: Delete each RADIUS client in the list.

segment.source: To do that, at the elevated command prompt, type this command and then press Enter:
segment.target: To do that, at the elevated command prompt, type this command and then press Enter:

segment.source: For example, this command deletes a RADIUS client named WirelessAP1 from the NPS server configuration:
segment.target: For example, this command deletes a RADIUS client named WirelessAP1 from the NPS server configuration:

segment.source: You can delete multiple RADIUS clients by inserting a comma between each client.
segment.target: You can delete multiple RADIUS clients by inserting a comma between each client.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: You can also remove a RADIUS client by using the following command.
segment.target: You can also remove a RADIUS client by using the following command.

segment.source: Repeat this procedure for each RADIUS client that's configured on the NPS server.
segment.target: Repeat this procedure for each RADIUS client that's configured on the NPS server.

segment.source: To delete a remote RADIUS server group from the NPS server configuration
segment.target: To delete a remote RADIUS server group from the NPS server configuration

segment.source: Display the list of remote RADIUS server groups that are configured on the NPS server.
segment.target: Display the list of remote RADIUS server groups that are configured on the NPS server.

segment.source: To do that, open an elevated command prompt, type the following command, and then press Enter:
segment.target: To do that, open an elevated command prompt, type the following command, and then press Enter:

segment.source: Delete each remote server group in the list.
segment.target: Delete each remote server group in the list.

segment.source: To do that, at the elevated command prompt, type this command and then press Enter:
segment.target: To do that, at the elevated command prompt, type this command and then press Enter:

segment.source: For example, this command deletes a remote RADIUS server group named RemoteServers1 from the NPS server configuration:
segment.target: For example, this command deletes a remote RADIUS server group named RemoteServers1 from the NPS server configuration:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you delete a remote RADIUS server group, all RADIUS servers that are contained in the group are deleted.
segment.target: When you delete a remote RADIUS server group, all RADIUS servers that are contained in the group are deleted.

segment.source: Repeat this procedure for each remote RADIUS server group that's configured on the NPS server.
segment.target: Repeat this procedure for each remote RADIUS server group that's configured on the NPS server.

segment.source: You can convert Netsh commands to Windows PowerShell® commands.
segment.target: You can convert Netsh commands to Windows PowerShell® commands.

segment.source: For more information, see the Netshell to Powershell Conversion Guide.
segment.target: For more information, see the Netshell to Powershell Conversion Guide.
